Articles.Content:
Anyone know when 1.0 is coming out? I am really excited and I will post a cool fan-work once it comes out. Any dates? Also, off topic, but who wants a epic low part count one launch one way Eeloo mission pack?! It comes with a Base, a station, 2 Rovers, 6 Sats, 2 Mini Probes, 2 crew transfer landers and one massive sat for a Geo-Sync orbit. Also it will have a transfer stage. I think the lifter will be Zeke's Cira V. Also, I'll have a stock version and a KAS version. 

-DMSP

Soonthuary Soonteenth, Two-Thousand-Soon.

Seriously though, SQUAD never announces release dates. It'll probably take a while though.

You know this is forbidden right and they wont give a release date because they usually en up having to push it back to fix bugs. KSP isnt ready for 1.0 anyway not till stable 64bit and mutiplayer. Next update parts will make it next to impossible to just have B9 installed let alone all its dependencies and there is no gameplay without mods. KSP will get ripped when it is released.

Quick! Post something in the thread before it gets locked!

srsly though, what everyone else said. It's in the rules actually: don't ask. Ever.

Inb4 lock!

The release date is Tuesday. No, not this week or next week. But it will definitely be a Tuesday. Unless it's late.

Actually I think it was stated somewhere that it wasn't going to be in February - I do wish we had more information like that. It's extremely easy to come up with estimates for that - it's the deadline estimates that are tricky ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

(my serious estimate would actually be sometime between June and October given the amount of complex things they're tackling)
Between now and the end of the world... ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

It will release when it is finished.

Squad has never liked giving out release dates, because they don't want to have to inform a disappointed userbase that a bug slipped through QA that needs to be patched. Even so, you can get a rough idea of how much they have done and have to do before 1.0 releases. Just looking at the last Devnote Tuesdays, the new Aero model has been pushed to QA, while the new procedual fairings have begun development.
That's enough, guys. No need to make silly jokes on it. We all know the topic of release dates is forbidden.
